rComments: unclear instructions, unfair test....50 M/C's, i think I knew all the answers to the questions but because of her tricky questions (made purposely), i got a really bad mark. If someone else was to test me on those MC's i would have gotten perfect. The short answers were horrible because she gave us no space to answer the questions properly.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader']

The options were from A-G and included answers such as "A and G" or "G and C" or "All of the Above" or "None of the above." and etc. Assignments are marked very unfairly also. Took double marks off for the same mistake. DO NOT TAKE HER.

teacherRatingTags: ['Test heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader']

rComments: I took this 2nd year course as a 4th year science student thinking it would be interesting and that hard work would pay off but I was wrong. Material was interesting, but the course paper was ridiculously hard and graded in a way that you're almost guaranteed to do poorly. Labs also consisted of trick questions to screw you up. Do not recommend.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Fun and quirky lecturer, but she makes course material way more difficult than it actually needs to be. Assignments aren't graded on actual comprehension or understanding of material, but whether or not you can identify random buzzwords. No one in the class did well. CR/NCR if you want to stay for the body stories. Drop the class otherwise.
teacherRatingTags: ['Hilarious', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader']

rComments: Super tough grader. Course material is actually easy but she makes it so complicated and confusing. Course is reliant on lecture slides but she doesn't post them online so you gotta go to class. Tutorials are super boring, doesn't help at all. She's not understanding with illnesses. Term project is unnecessarily complicated. Would not take again.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: Lecture outlines are posted but you have to attend class to get the full information, especially since tests and lab work are lecture based. Super clear instructions for any assignments. teacherRatingTags: ['Respected', 'Clear grading criteria', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: very lecture heavy, only posts outline of lecture online, attendance is mandatory. Overall very good professor, always engages you in lectures, makes topics interesting, takes things very serious
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: great course, great prof!

There's no textbook for this class, and everything is based on lectures and practicals. As long as you show up and take good notes, you can do really well. The questions are exactly from the slides (although she doesn't post slides so write it all down) and practical assignments. Outside of class she is insanely nice, and really approachable
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Gives good feedback', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: She was horrible, the class is entirely based on lectures but she doesn't post any online (only outlines) so attendance is mandatory. Not very understanding.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader']

rComments: I like her! teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: She is a nice prof overall. Her anecdotes during most of her lectures make it worth showing up and entertaining especially since she does not post lecture slides. Her quizzes and tests seem harder than they have to be but she is a very fair professor. If you show up, take notes and study before the quizzes and tests you'll do fine.

rComments: Prof. Wood is really nice and kind of dorky. She doesn't post lectures, so you have to attend, but the tests are super easy if you go to class. Make sure you study lectures, the textbook, AND practicals. It's all on the tests
